summary.p: Single folio parchment Qurʾān manuscript with the shelfmark M.2002.1.351. Qurʾān text: Q 54:31-55:8. At the moment only the image of the fol 1 recto is given by the institution.

There are three other folios in the same collection, that originally belonged to the same codex: M.2002.1.350, M.2002.1.374 and M.2002.1.375. The four sister fragments arranged according to the Qurʾānic text they cover: (1) Q 31:14-25, M.2002.1.350, (2) Q 54:31-55:8, M.2002.1.351, (3) Q 68:29-69:4, M.2002.1.374 and (4) Q 70:27-71:6, M.2002.1.375.
Cf. the website of the institution: https://collections.lacma.org/node/204530.

support.p: Verse division and illumination: Simple verse separators consist of a group of three small strokes arranged one above the other. Tenth verse separator consists of a golden medallion ornament with the abǧad-numeral placed inside the circle, in this case the letter mīm to indicate the 40. verse on the fol. 1r. Other folios of the same Qurʾān codex show illuminated division between two sūrahs, a band ornament using gold, blue and red ink each with different geometrical patterns, that fill out the whole line.
Short strokes were used at the end of a line to fill out the space.

summary.p: Script style kūfi B.II with some variations. The letter ʾalif slightly bands to the right. The tail of the letter ʿayn in the final position extends generously. The lām-ʾalif ligature has more resemblance with the shape seen in the B.Ib style.
Diacritical marks are used sparsely and are indicated by oblique strokes. Vocalisation is marked by red and blue (?) dots.
